Praise ye the LORD. I will praise the LORD with <FI>my<Fi> whole heart, in the assembly of the upright, and <FI>in<Fi> the congregation.<RF>Praise ye…: Heb. Hallelujah<Rf>
The works of the LORD <FI>are<Fi> great, sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.
His work <FI>is<Fi> honourable and glorious: and his righteousness endureth for ever.
He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered: the LORD <FI>is<Fi> gracious and full of compassion.
He hath given meat unto them that fear him: he will ever be mindful of his covenant.<RF>meat: Heb. prey<Rf><CM>
He hath shewed his people the power of his works, that he may give them the heritage of the heathen.
The works of his hands <FI>are<Fi> verity and judgment; all his commandments <FI>are<Fi> sure.
They stand fast for ever and ever, <FI>and are<Fi> done in truth and uprightness.<RF>stand…: Heb. are established<Rf>
He sent redemption unto his people: he hath commanded his covenant for ever: holy and reverend <FI>is<Fi> his name.

The fear of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> the beginning of wisdom: a good understanding have all they that do <FI>his commandments<Fi>: his praise endureth for ever.<RF>a good…: or, good success<Rf><RF>his commandments: Heb. them<Rf><CM>
